moves.1. h4: Unusual Opening, I'd never seen this before!
moves.1... e5: but continue with my opening, nonetheless
moves.2. Rh3: Bringing the Rook Into play, a remarkably unusual opening!
moves.2... d5: Bringing Pawn out, and threatening the rook
moves.3... Bd6: Guarding E5, but unintentionally endagering D5
moves.4. d4: nonetheless, he threatens E6, hoping to make a profit
moves.5. b3 Be6: Guarding the still-vulnerable D5, while developing.
moves.6... exd4: but I see a weakness and begin the save my pawn
moves.8. Rf2: Guarding with the rook. Usual, since most would play G3 as it is guarded by rook, howeve then I would BD6xF4
moves.9... a5: Originally planned to move the knight, and so built a secondary defense to the bishop
moves.10. f5: Trying to move the bishop, thinking the rook would keep him safe
moves.11... Bc3: Safe space, and threatening the rook as well
moves.13... Be4: defending the knight, who is in little danger anyway, but also threatening the queen
moves.14... O-O-O: Protecting the king, B7, and also securing D column for me
moves.15. Qc4 Bxc2: move my bishop, putting me one away from mate, while also leaving my queen unguarded, seemingly by mistake.
moves.16. Qxh4: He believes it to be a mistake, and so takes...
